name: Amoxicillin
description: A broad-spectrum antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections, ear infections, and urinary tract infections.

name: Ciprofloxacin
description: Used to treat various bacterial infections including urinary tract infections, respiratory tract infections, and skin infections.

name: Azithromycin
description: Commonly used to treat respiratory infections, skin infections, and sexually transmitted infections.

name: Doxycycline
description: Used for treating bacterial infections like pneumonia, acne, and certain sexually transmitted infections.

name: Cephalexin
description: Effective against bacterial infections such as ear infections, skin infections, and urinary tract infections.

name: Metronidazole
description: Treats bacterial and protozoal infections, including those in the gastrointestinal tract and reproductive system.

name: Clindamycin
description: Used for serious bacterial infections such as those affecting the lungs, skin, and internal organs.

name: Levofloxacin
description: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic for treating infections like pneumonia, urinary tract infections, and sinusitis.

name: Vancomycin
description: Reserved for severe bacterial infections, including MRSA and infections resistant to other antibiotics.

name: Rifampin
description: Used in combination therapy to treat tuberculosis and other bacterial infections.

name: Erythromycin
description: Treats a variety of bacterial infections including respiratory tract infections and skin infections.

name: Tetracycline
description: Used to treat bacterial infections such as acne, cholera, and syphilis.

name: Penicillin
description: One of the earliest antibiotics used to treat a range of bacterial infections including strep throat and syphilis.

name: Bactrim (Sulfamethoxazole/Trimethoprim)
description: A combination antibiotic for treating urinary tract infections, bronchitis, and ear infections.

name: Linezolid
description: Effective against multidrug-resistant Gram-positive infections, including MRSA and VRE.
